meanings.definition: A large collection or amount of something
meanings.sent1: She had rafters of books in her library, neatly organized by genre.
meanings.sent2: The store had rafters of colorful balloons for the party.
meanings.sent3: The kids had rafters of fun playing in the park all day.
meanings.sent4: The chef prepared a rafters of delicious dishes for the event.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with a rafters of blooming flowers in the spring.

meanings.definition: A flat structure made of logs or planks fastened together for floating on water
meanings.sent1: The explorers built a rafters to cross the river safely.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen used a rafters to reach the deeper waters.
meanings.sent3: The ducks gathered on the rafters, enjoying the calm lake.
meanings.sent4: The castaway relied on a rafters to survive in the open sea.
meanings.sent5: The campers constructed a rafters to relax on the lake during their trip.
